description: Registration opens
Event intro
Opening Keynote - "Chasing Fun: Creating a Career You Love"

speakers.name: Michael Flarup
speakers.about: Danish designer & entrepreneur. He runs game studio Northplay, design studio Pixelresort and resource platform Apply Pixels.

description: The History of iOS App Development

speakers.name: Adam Shaw
speakers.about: iOS app developer since the dawn of time (aka 2008). An Apple nerd through and through, he loves sharing his knowledge and enthusiasm for app development with others.

description: Why Didn't I Know That? Hidden Gems for Swift and SwiftUI Developers

speakers.name: Stewart Lynch
speakers.about: An independent iOS developer with a focus on helping other improve their coding skills through his YouTube channel.

description: Code That Survives 'The Handoff'

speakers.name: Jacob Rakidzich
speakers.about: A software engineer with a deep passion for Swift and Kotlin, focusing primarily on iOS application development. Aside from mobile applications, and experience as an AWS Solutions Architect. His goal is to craft code that's not just functional but is a place you WANT to spend time in.

description: Prompt Engineering for Accessibility

speakers.name: Allison McEntire
speakers.about: Staff Engineer for Nuuly, a clothing rental subscription service from Urban Outfitters.

description: Morning welcome
From Overwhelmed to Confident: Understanding Swift Concurrency

speakers.name: Antoine van der Lee
speakers.about: Creator of RocketSim (an Xcode Simulator Enhancing App) and author of weekly blog posts on SwiftLee and newsletter SwiftLee Weekly.

description: I'm the Problem, It's Me

speakers.name: Adrian Eves
speakers.about: iOS developer who's worked for companies such as Apple, Inc and the Walt Disney Company. He is the developer of the app, Pediapal, a tool for parents to manage the health, vitals, and care of their children.

description: Contributing to the Swift Compiler: My Journey

speakers.name: Sima Nerush
speakers.about: A recent Reed College graduate, Swift programmer, and Swift compiler contributor.

description: Just Grow With It: Lessons in indie app marketing

speakers.name: Jordan Morgan
speakers.about: Indie developer and author of the best-in-class iOS app book series. Serially tired dad.

description: Learning in Public: My Journey to 10

speakers.name: Danielle Lewis
speakers.about: Published 10 apps to the App Store in 2024 and documented her journey on social media, a BSCS student, a dog mom, and a wife.

description: Pizza will save your startup

speakers.name: Vidit Bhargava
speakers.about: A successful Apple platform developer and designer with over 13 years of experience in making apps for Apple platforms. Vidit's app LookUp: English Dictionary is a modern day dictionary app that enables English learners to learn new words in innovative ways through illustrations and interactive quizzes.

description: The Roast of your App's Design

speakers.name: Hidde van der Ploeg
speakers.about: A designer who taught himself how to code and make apps. His own apps include popular apps like Helm, NowPlaying, Gola, and Volo.

description: Live ASO Roast: You Bring the App, I'll "Tell You What's Wrong"
Launched Live with Charlie Chapman and guests

speakers.name: Charlie Chapman
speakers.about: Host of Launched, creator of Dark Noise, and developer advocate at RevenueCat.

speakers.name: Ryan Ashcraft
speakers.about: Independent developer of Foodnoms, a thoughtfully designed nutrition tracker for iPhone, iPad, and Mac that helps people improve their health through better nutrition. Previously worked at Confluent, Amplitude, and Yahoo.

speakers.name: Neem Serra
speakers.about: Principal iOS developer at Stitch Fix and lives in the St. Louis area. Neem loves to write Swift code with as many references as possible to Taylor Swift.

speakers.name: Edward Sánchez
speakers.about: Designer with over a decade of experience crafting thoughtful, user-focused designs. Spent 9 years at Apple, including 5 on the Xcode team, focusing on visual design, iconography and animation. Also codes in Swift to build interactive prototypes.

description: Morning welcome
App Intents, Actions, and Personal Context - Oh My!

speakers.name: Matthew Cassinelli
speakers.about: App Intents developer consultant and Shortcuts expert after being part of the Workflow team before it was acquired by Apple.

description: Serving Slices of Your App: The Underrated Potential of App Clips

speakers.name: Matt Heaney
speakers.about: Mobile enginering manager passionate about giving back to the community. Whether it's teaching code online or sharing knowledge, Matt love helping others grow their skills and succeed in tech.

description: Shaders: The Secret Sauce of Modern Visual Interactions

speakers.name: Laksh Chakraborty
speakers.about: Been in the world of iOS development for over 5 years now, and in 2024 finally got the chance to begin doing it professionally. Recently graduated from NYU with a degree in Computer Science, and currently work at Typo* building a collaborative messenger designed for media-centric professionals.

description: Lunch
From Spaghetti to Pizza Code

speakers.name: Xingyu Wang
speakers.about: iOS engineer at Duolingo for 4 years. Enjoys Zen meditation, running, and reading

speakers.name: Carter Levin
speakers.about: iOS Engineer at Duolingo, where he develops core tools and components to make the codebase easier and safer to work with. Outside of Duolingo he is interested in iOS game development, and plays lots of Squash.

description: How I built a Vapor website without HTML, CSS, or JavaScript

speakers.name: Tyler Thompson
speakers.about: Lover of Swift, developer, and manager with about 18 years industry experience. Worked at companies both big and small. Regular contributor to the open source community and creator of Afluent, an open source Combine replacement built for Swift concurrency.

description: Coordinate Spaces and You

speakers.name: Harlan Haskins
speakers.about: Harlan currently leads engineering at typo.inc. Previously, he worked on UIKit and SwiftUI for visionOS for Apple and the Swift compiler.

description: Musical performance by James Dempsey and the Breakpoints
Closing Keynote
Closing Words
